3. Setting Up and running inbox kitten (Serverless)¶

3.1. notes¶

  • dev is only compatible with node 10 currently

  • dev needs to be runned with api concurrently

3.2. Setting up and running API¶

  1. Open a bash terminal

  2. Enter the following command into the terminal

cd api

  1. Enter the following command into the terminal

npm install

  1. Go to /api/config and find mailgunConfig.sample.js, make a copy and rename the copy as mailgunConfig.js. Edit the apikey and email domain respectively.

  • APIKEY: Mailgun’s private API key

  • EMAIL DOMAIN: Mailgun’s provided email domain e.g. sandbox82ha8919eja9djs.mailgun.org

  1. Enter the following command into the terminal

npm run start

Currently, if nothing else was set up, an message indicating index.html is missing should appear.

  1. You can proceed to any of this url extensions

  • /api/v1/mail/list

  • /api/v1/mail/getinfo

  • /api/v1/mail/gethtml

3.3. Setting up and running dev¶

  1. Open up another bash terminal

  2. Enter the following command into the terminal

cd ui

  1. Enter the following command into the terminal

apt-get update
apt-get install python 2 make build-essential

  1. Since inbox kitten only works in node 10, enter the following command

node -v
npm install -g n
n 10

  1. Now open up another bash terminal and enter and run the following commands

cd ui
npm install

  1. Go to /ui/config and find apiConfig.sample.js, make a copy and rename the copy as apiConfig.js. Edit the website_domain and domain respectively.

NOTE:

  • WEBSITE_DOMAIN is the address your api is running on. So if it’s running on localhost:8000 , WEBSITE_DOMAIN is localhost:8000.

  • DOMAIN is the mailgun email link. e.g. sandbox209sa9sa892.mailgun.org

  1. Enter the following command into the terminal

npm run dev

  1. If you want to view the dev. Example if localhost:8000 is the website domain, go to locahost:8000/api/v1/mail to see the program.

3.4. Setting up and running build¶

  1. Change directory to ui via this command

cd ui

  1. For deployment, enter the following command

npm run build

  1. Copy contents of ui/dist folder into api/public folder using this command

cp -r dist/* ../api/public

  1. Change directory to api via this command

cd ../api

  1. Lastly enter this command to run the build

npm run start
